Glosses: half	only	1DU>3SG.F:RPST:PFV\leave	EMPH	DEM:PROX	throat	ALR	1DU>3SG.F:RPST:PFV\cut	bamboo_knife	=INS
Translation: (They replied) "We left her half dead. We cut her throat with the bamboo knife.
She'll just die up there."

Primary_Text: ŋafsinzth "oh nima tüfr thänkwre tüfrmär thfrä nzenme tüfr thäkwrath"
Analyzed_Word: ŋa\fsi/nzth	oh	nima	tüfr	thän\kwr/e	tüfr	=mär	thf\rä/	nzenme	tüfr	thä\kwr/ath
Translation: Then they took stock: "Oh, we killed so and so many of them, not many. But they killed many of us."
They slept and woke up in the morning.
They rushed off and came to Sazäthi.
Next, they came to Méndüfi.

Primary_Text: fä fof wath thräntrifth ebar wath
Analyzed_Word: fä	fof	wath	thrän\trif/th	ebar	wath
Translation: This is where they would sing a headhunting song.

Analyzed_Word: eh	ausi~	ausi	=é	bada	=é	foba	kre\karis/th
Translation: "Hey", the old women and the grandmothers heard them (and said)
"They've already killed them. Now they're coming back singing."

Analyzed_Word: ausi~	ausi	ŋa\fyen/wrth	kafar~	kafar	nä
Translation: The women and some older women stood in a row,
and they started jumping up and down holding their fishing nets.

Primary_Text: krethkäfth fi benrä ebarkarä anemewä thränthor

Translation: The (men) began to approach the village and held the heads

Translation: and they began to whatchamacallit ... to put the heads in the fishing nets.
They took them to the old people and finished (the ritual).

Primary_Text: watik ŋamsakwath fof kwathwekwrmth kafar brubru sufnzrmth oh
Analyzed_Word: watik	ŋa\msak/wath	fof	kwa\thwek/wrmth	kafar	brubru	su\fn/zrmth	oh
Translation: Then they sat down and enjoyed themselves. They beat the big drum (to let everyone know).
The people heard this (and said)
"They've killed them already.
The Farem people, the Fethka people and the Mongarkam people killed them."
